headline: GM To End Production Of Its Most Affordable EV, Move Buick From China To US: Report
summary: General Motors Co. (NYSE:GM) will reportedly end production of its most affordable EV, the Chevrolet Bolt, as well as move Buick production out of China into Kansas. GM's Production Reshuffle The Detroit-based automaker will shift production of the Gas-powered Chevrolet Equinox and the upcoming Buick Envision away from Mexico and China, respectively, to its facility in Fairfax, Kansas, TechCrunch reported on Thursday. headline: How GM’s Buick Envision Reshoring and Tariff Pressures Will Impact General Motors (GM) Investors
summary: General Motors recently confirmed it will shift production of the next-generation Buick Envision SUV from China to its Fairfax Assembly plant in Kansas City, Kansas, with U.S.-bound models to be built there from 2028 onward. This manufacturing reshuffle underscores how tariffs and trade policy are reshaping GM’s global footprint, pushing more SUV and crossover production into higher-cost but politically favored U.S. facilities. We’ll look at how this move to reshore Buick Envision production...

headline: Mag 7 earnings, Fed's rate decision: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come throughout next week, including a wide array of earnings results due out from major companies like Microsoft (MSFT), Meta Platforms (META), Apple (AAPL), Tesla (TSLA), and many more; and the Federal Reserve's latest interest rate decision followed by a press conference with chairman Jerome Powell.
